newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Microsoft trades lower.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Microsoft trades lower.

text.p: Microsoft Corp dropped 5/8 of a point in after-hours trading on Monday, after rising two points during regular trading.
"Microsoft's trading down for some reason," one trader said. "I don't know why."
Microsoft was trading after hours at 98-7/8, down from 99-1/2 at the closing bell. It had closed Friday at 97-1/2.
Late Monday afternoon Microsoft announced it bought Interse Corp, a privately held developer of Web site analysis software, for an undisclosed price.
The session one and session two volumes were not available Monday from the New York Stock Exchange.
